intro: Salacistis novembrilis, commonly known as the autumn bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy foliage. The plant produces striking bell-shaped flowers in shades of purple and blue, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem, and it thrives in well-drained, loamy soils. Salacistis novembrilis is often found in woodland edges and meadows, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
